results.name: a(n) = number of occurrences of a most frequent nonzero digit in factorial base representation (A007623) of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10080
Index entries for sequences related to factorial base representation
example: n  A007623(n)   a(n) [highest number of times any nonzero digit occurs].
program: def a007623(n, p=2): return n if n
def a051903(n): return 0 if n==1 else max(factorint(n).values())
return 1 if n==0 else reduce(mul, [prime(y[i][0])**y[i][1] for i in range(len(y))])
def a(n): return 0 if n==0 else a051903(a275735(n))
print([a(n) for n in range(201)]) # _Indranil Ghosh_, Jun 20 2017
xref: Cf. A265349 (positions of terms <= 1), A265350 (positions of term > 1).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Dec 22 2015
